climbs.name: Vista
climbs.fa: Chance Weith, Ryan Richardson, Dave Hug

content.description:
Climb up the ledge and move and grab a nice jug to position yourself on the upper face. Pull hard through a series of shallow pockets and eventually use both sides of the arete to reach the anchor 

  Note: potentially the best scenic views at the park
content.location: Just a few feet right of The Fathers Gift.Â

content.description: Climb the thin crack in the center of the wall
content.protection:
Traditional gear smaller sizes with a bolted anchor 

  NOTE: There is a low bolt "hip height" for the belayer to anchor themselves into

content.description: Climb the arete using both the arete and face holds to reach the anchor
content.protection:
3 bolts to the anchor 

  NOTE: There is a low bolt "hip height" for the belayer to anchor themselves into
content.location: Right most route of Ryan's Balcony

climbs.name: The Father's Gift
climbs.fa: Chance Weith, Ryan Richardson, Dave Hug

content.description:
Thank Ryan Richardson for this one. Strong contender for best route of Pere Marquette. 

  Climb the well protected face beginning with underlings and side pulls. Stand up on the small ledge and make a long reach to good pockets on the right side of the bolt line. Make the clip and begin using the holds on the left again. From here follow the rail and continue up and left to the anchor.
content.location: Left most side of the wall

content.description: Not yet bolted. From the ledge its the left most bolted short route
content.protection:
Eventually 2-3 bolts to the anchor 

  NOTE: There is a low bolt "hip height" for the belayer to anchor themselves into
content.location: Leftmost route perched on top of the ledge

content.description: This short wall, just past Hornbein's Wall, has several routes on it. The majority of the routes are short, but there are two routes on the left side that are worthy
